{{fr-noun|f}}

# {{lb|fr|anatomy}} [[portal vein]] {{gloss|short, wide vein located in the abdominal cavity formed by the union of the superior mesenteric and splenic veins that channels blood from the gastrointestinal tract and spleen to capillary beds in the liver}}
types.html:
veine porte f (plural veines portes)

  1. (anatomy) portal vein (short, wide vein located in the abdominal cavity formed by the union of the superior mesenteric and splenic veins that channels blood from the gastrointestinal tract and spleen to capillary beds in the liver)

title: veine porte
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /vɛn pɔʁt/
